_definition.iso_639_3_eng: GeoJSON geometry describing a geographic feature.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: This descriptor can be used to define the geometry of a geographic feature. The value must be a [GeoJSON](https://geojson.org) `geometry` structure.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Area of the GeoJSON geometry in square meters.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: This descriptor can be used to indicate a precise point in space or the centroid of a complex shape. The value must be a [GeoJSON](https://geojson.org) `Point` geometry.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: The radius from a point or centroid that determines the geometry area.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: This descriptor can be used, in conjunction with a *centroid* or *point* to determine the area of the current geometry.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: A GeoJSON geometry enclosing a shape.

_description.iso_639_3_eng:
This descriptor can be used to provide a frame around another shape, it will generally be a polygon that delimits one or more shapes including an optional buffer. These shapes will typically be the [geometry](geometry.md) property of the current object. The value must be a [GeoJSON](https://geojson.org) `geometry` structure.

One usage is when dealing with raster data of fixed resolution: the geometry could be a point and the geometry bounds could be the bounding box around the point representing the resolution.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Unique identifier of a shape or geometry.

_description.iso_639_3_eng:
This descriptor should be the *unique reference* of a [geometry](geometry.md) in a *collection* containing only *distinct geometries*.

The value is obtained by *hashing* the [geometry](geometry.md) [GeoJSON](https://geojson.org) structure: the result is a *string* that *uniquely identifies* the *shape*. This string *will* then *become* the [unique ID](_key.md) of the *record containing the shape*.

Hashing the shape structure allows mixing different geometry types and guarantees that each shape will have a different identifier. Currently we use the [MD5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MD5) hash function on the string representation of the [geometry](geometry.md).

The hashing means that if you *change* the *shape* of the polygon, it becomes a *new polygon*. This means that remote sensing data will have to be extracted for that new shape.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: List of shape or geometry unique identifiers.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: This descriptor contains a list of [unique references](geometry_hash.md) to a [geometry](geometry.md) record belonging to another *collection*.

This descriptor is generally used to *group* properties or features in a [GeoJSON](https://geojson.org) record. The goal is to *prevent* having *feature properties* at the *top level* of the *record* and, instead, have a *property* that will *only* contain *feature data*.

This is not reserved only to geographic records.
Provide the *species* of the *individual tree* or *population* to which *data* is *referring* to.

_examples.iso_639_3_eng: Pinus sylvestris, Abies alba, Delonix regia var. genuina

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Trees or population list of species.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Provide the *list of species* of the *individual trees* or *population* to which *data* is *referring* to. See the [species](species.md) descriptor for more information and examples.
